alert.note: Alert for Guadalupe Mountains of Eddy County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 16 at 8:31PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT/7 AM CDT/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast New Mexico and Texas, including the following areas, in southeast New Mexico, Guadalupe Mountains of Eddy County. In Texas, Central Brewster County, Chinati Mountains, Chisos Basin, Davis Mountains, Davis Mountains Foothills, Eastern Culberson County, Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet, Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains, Lower Brewster County, Marfa Plateau, Pecos, Presidio Valley, Reeves County Plains, Terrell and Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT/7 AM CDT/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Ongoing rainfall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
